Node.definition: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
= man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which humans or forces take hold of objects and cause them to rise up from a certain location

= a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way
= causative action by which humans refrain from sharing information with others

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= deity; ► worshiped by people of Babel (בָּבֶל)

Node.gloss: to fear|to be afraid|to be discouraged
Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals lack inner strength and courage
= deity; ► patron deity of Babylon (בָּבֶל)

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship

Node.gloss: to fear|to be afraid|to be discouraged
Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals lack inner strength and courage
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
particle linking two objects, of which the first is not always listed explicitly; = relation indicating that object X and object Y are at opposite ends of a range of similar objects
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= action by which humans or animals move quickly and nervously from one place to another, ► usually to escape impending danger
= process by which someone is going to die, described as a movement in one way only
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= action by which humans associate themselves with another human, a group of people, or a deity for a particular purpose
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= action by which someone does not stay in a single expected location but moves about from place to place without a clear destination
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
exact meaning unsure; possible: = causative action by which humans in authority cause other humans move from place to place in a certain area
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= place where animals lie down to rest
= process by which humans or objects come upon (other) humans or objects without searching
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be guilty|to be in the wrong|to have wronged
Node.definition: = to bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= indirect male progenitor
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or animals move quickly and nervously from one place to another, ► usually to escape impending danger
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= dominant male goat in a צֹאן (צֹאן) ≈ associated with authority

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which someone causes someone else's inactivity to end so that he comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land

Node.gloss: to have (one's) fill > to be contented
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated; hence: = process by which the desire of humans is fulfilled
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= female young of a cow (פָּרָה) ► used as sacrifice
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression
= male horse; ► mainly used for carrying soldiers and drawing chariots; ≈ associated with power, strength, and warfare

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

Node.gloss: mother > place of origin and sustenance
Node.definition: = a nation or a city representing a nation, ◄ here compared to a mother, and its citizens to her children who are responsible for her well being
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= pertaining to being the least significant in a group of objects

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions; ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
= process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a place or area has been made the home of humans
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= causative action by which humans bend a bow (קֶשֶׁת) by drawing its string towards them ► in order to shoot an arrow
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= action by which an object, used as a weapon, is caused to move forcefully in a certain direction

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
literally: to give (one's) hand (to someone); hence: = action by which humans accept the authority of other humans, or of a deity
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a structure loses its inner strength and falls apart
exact meaning unknown; probably: = type of fortification

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
literally: to cut off; hence: = causative process by which a certain category of people or animals are removed from a particular group

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= large, curved knife with a short wooden handle (15 20 centimeters); ► used for cutting grain
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= male or female herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and strength

Node.gloss: to drive out|to cast out|to disperse
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to leave their place or position using force
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= causative action by which animals chew on the bones of their prey, which may be broken in the process; ≈ used figuratively to denote one nation conquering and destroying another
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

Node.gloss: to take back|to bring back|to return|to put back|to restore (something)
Node.definition: literally: to turn; hence: = causative action by which animals, humans, deities cause (other) animals, humans, or objects to move back to a location where they have been before

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= mountain; ◄ located in north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) overlooking the Mediterranean Sea
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= an area dominated by elevations of the earth's surface
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= area on east side of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ◄ supposedly named after Gilead, son of Makir (מָכִיר) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

Node.gloss: to have (one's) fill > to be contented
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated; hence: = process by which the desire of humans is fulfilled

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= region; ◄ south of Babylon (בָּבֶל)

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= an ethnic group and their territory, ◄ located E of the river Tigris (חִדֶּקֶל)

Node.gloss: to fight|to kill|to put to the sword
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans fight each other with a sword (חֶרֶב) usually resulting in death

Node.gloss: to destroy|to kill|to exterminate|to wipe out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans wipe out (other) humans and objects from existence
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= causative action by which a human being breaks an object into two pieces in a violent way, so that it will no longer be functional

= instrument of about 30 centimeters long, consisting of a handle, usually made of wood, to which was attached a stone, wooden, or (less frequently) metal head; ► used for many purposes, including the breaking or dressing of building stones, pounding nails or pegs into wood, or pounding pegs into the ground; also used by blacksmiths to shape hot metal

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which someone tries to gain control over someone else in an unjust way, ◄ as if that person were an animal caught in a net or trap

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= a referent to a female participant addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans provoke other humans to anger and so cause conflicts

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= place(s) where one's valuable goods are store

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= building ► used for storing grain
= causative action by which humans create piles of rubble or other objects from a city that is destroyed and pillaged

Node.gloss: to destroy|to kill|to exterminate|to wipe out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans wipe out (other) humans and objects from existence

Node.gloss: to fight|to kill|to put to the sword
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans fight each other with a sword (חֶרֶב) usually resulting in death
= young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to fall down|to sink down|to descend
Node.definition: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= causative action by which humans kill animals by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp bladed instrument, ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression
= exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= soldier specialized in fighting with bow and arrow
= causative action by which humans bend a bow (קֶשֶׁת) by drawing its string towards them ► in order to shoot an arrow
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

Node.gloss: to set up (a tent)|to erect (a tent)|to encamp
Node.definition: = action by which an individual or group of people settles in a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to act presumptuously|to presume|to defy|to scheme (against someone)
Node.definition: = process by which someone fails to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly, described as an inner boiling that eventually gives rise to action; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, aggression, and rebellion against God
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads
literally: a person of battle; hence: = a person that is of age and physically able to bear arms

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, foolishness, aggression, and rebellion against God
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them

= state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, foolishness, aggression, and rebellion against God
= process by which humans or animals lose their balance while walking or standing and end up flat on the ground; ≈ associated with failure and loss of face

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to set fire on|to set on fire
Node.definition: = action by which someone causes something to start burning, usually with effects on people and nature around; ≈ associated with punishment and judgement

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= a person or entity ► that forcibly carries off an animal, person, or group
= action by which humans or deities take or maintain firm control of (other) humans or objects
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

Node.gloss: to let go|to dismiss|to send (someone) on his way|to free|to release
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities allow (other) humans to leave a certain place and go home

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

Node.gloss: to plead (another's cause)|to defend|to take up (another's) cause
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities resolve a conflict for their own benefit or for the benefit of (other) humans who may not be in a position to do that for themselves

Node.gloss: to plead (another's cause)|to defend|to take up (another's) cause
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities resolve a conflict for their own benefit or for the benefit of (other) humans who may not be in a position to do that for themselves

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
literally: to give rest; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans with an agitated and fearful mind to find new confidence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to shake; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= person who speaks on behalf of a deity or other supernatural power; ≈ probably associated with foolishness

Node.gloss: to be foolish|to be ignorant|to be without understanding
Node.definition: = to be and/or behave like one with little insight, education or wisdom; ≈ pejorative (see the related term אִוֶּלֶת (אִוֶּלֶת)
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: to fear|to be afraid|to be discouraged
Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals lack inner strength and courage
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= a group of chariots (מֶרְכָּבָה) usually owned by one single person
= group of people of mixed ethnic origin
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well being
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= longer period of dry weather, often with high temperatures, ► resulting in shortage of water and failing crops
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death
= action by which humans act in a way that is regarded as abnormal and associated with people who are insane
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= animal or animal like creature, usually found in desert areas, ► that are hostile to humans; ≈ possibly associated with demons
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
exact meaning unsure: = animal ≈ associated with death, destruction, and devastation
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
see יַעְַנָה (יַעֲנָה)
= state in which a place or area has been made the home of humans
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= causative action by which humans or deities destroy an object completely ◄ as if by turning it completely upside down
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ located near Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) ► town where Lot (לֹוט) settled, when he separated himself from Abram (אַבְרָם) destroyed with Gomorrah (עֲמֹרָה)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ located near Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) ►destroyed with Sodom (סְדֹם)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= the part of an object or area that is the furthest away from the perspective of the speaker or narrator

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

= a type of short spear (רֹמַח) or large arrow (חֵץ) made of wood or reed, and therefore relatively light and more suited for throwing from a standing position or while riding on a horse or in a chariot

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
= pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)
literally: a person of battle; hence: = a person that is of age and physically able to bear arms
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: (one's) hands are weak; hence: = state in which humans lack the confidence to perform a certain event
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
= state of strong fear and distress, compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side effects, like writhing and trembling
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
= state of not being subject to change

Node.gloss: to act in a moment|to act suddenly
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities perform an action at an unexpected moment and with speed

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= causative action by which humans or deities give someone else a certain responsibility or position of authority with regards to an object, a group of people, or an entire land or nation

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which someone orders someone else to come to a certain location

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= causative action by which humans or animals move relatively heavy objects by pulling them over the ground

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
